title: How to Make Quinoa Blondies

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
steps.description: Set your oven to preheat while you complete the recipe. Line an 8x8 baking pan with parchment paper. Set it aside for now.

steps.headline: Mix the coconut oil and almond butter together.
steps.description: Measure out the two ingredients and place them in a medium-sized mixing bowl. Beat them together (either by hand or with an electric mixer set on medium speed) until the ingredients are incorporated and the mixture looks creamy.

steps.headline: Add the sugar, vanilla, flax eggs, and almond milk.
steps.description: Measure out these ingredients and place all of them into the bowl with the almond butter-coconut oil mixture. Beat the ingredients together until well-mixed.

steps.headline: Whisk together the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Measure out the coconut sugar, quinoa flour, salt and baking powder and place them together in a separate bowl. Use a whisk to mix them together until fully incorporated.

steps.headline: Combine the dry ingredients with the wet ones.
steps.description: Dump your bowl of dry ingredients into the bowl holding the coconut oil-almond butter mixture. Mix well until fully incorporated. Fold the chocolate chips into the batter.

steps.headline: Bake for 25 to 30 minutes.
steps.description: Pour the batter into the prepared 8x8 baking pan. Check to make sure the oven has fully preheated. Place the pan on the center rack in your oven and allow the blondies to bake for 25 to 30 minutes. You’ll know they’re done when a toothpick inserted into the center comes out with only a few moist crumbs on it.

steps.headline: Remove the blondies from the oven.
steps.description: After the blondies have finished baking, pull out the pan and set it aside. Allow the blondies to cool completely in the pan, then cut them into 12 to 16 squares. Store them in an airtight container, such as Tupperware, for up to five days.

methods.name: Baking Gluten-Free Chocolate Chip Quinoa Blondies

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
steps.description: Your oven will finish preheating while you complete the rest of the recipe. Line an 8x8 baking pan with parchment paper or foil, letting it overhang slightly on each end. Spray it with cooking spray and set it aside for now.

steps.headline: Mix the butter and nut butter together.
steps.description: Measure out the ingredients and place them in a medium-sized mixing bowl. Use an electric mixer to beat the ingredients together until they appear creamy and fully incorporated.

steps.headline: Add the eggs, brown sugar and vanilla.
steps.description: Measure out the brown sugar and vanilla and add them to the butter mixture. Crack the eggs, one at a time, and add them to the mixture. Use the mixer to beat the ingredients together until fully incorporated.

steps.headline: Combine the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Measure out the quinoa flour, baking powder and salt and place them together in a small bowl. Whisk them together.

steps.headline: Combine the dry ingredients with the wet ones.
steps.description: Add the bowl of dry ingredients to the mixing bowl with the butter mixture. Fold them gently together; do not over-mix. Add the chocolate chips.

steps.headline: Bake the blondies for 25 to 35 minutes.
steps.description: Spread the batter into the prepared 8x8 baking pan. Make sure to spread it evenly. Place the baking pan into the preheated oven and bake the blondies for 25 to 35 minutes. Check on them around the 25 minute mark. Insert a toothpick into the center. When it comes out with only a few crumbs on it, the blondies are ready to be taken out.

steps.headline: Remove the pan from the oven and let cool for 45 minutes.
steps.description: Once cooled, use the overhanging parchment paper (or foil) to help you lift the entire block of blondies out of the pan. Set onto a cutting board or other flat surface and cut them into about 24 equally sized squares. Let the squares finish cooling the rest of the way before storing them in an airtight container.

methods.name: Making Pumpkin Spice Almond Butter Quinoa Blondies

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
steps.description: Line an 8x8 baking pan with parchment paper. Set it aside for now.

steps.headline: Combine the coconut oil and almond butter.
steps.description: Measure out the ingredients and add them to a mixing bowl. Beat them together until the mixture looks creamy and smooth.

steps.headline: Add the sugar, flax eggs, maple syrup, and vanilla.
steps.description: Measure out these ingredients and add them to the butter mixture in the mixing bowl. Beat them with an electric mixer on medium speed until the ingredients are fully incorporated.

steps.headline: Combine the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Measure out the coconut sugar, pumpkin pie spice, salt, quinoa flour and baking powder and add them to a separate bowl. Use a whisk to mix the dry ingredients together until well-mixed.

steps.headline: Combine the dry and wet ingredients together.
steps.description: Pour the dry ingredients into the bowl holding the wet ingredients. Mix them together completely. Gently fold the chocolate chips into the batter.

steps.headline: Transfer the batter into the prepared 8x8 baking pan.
steps.description: It will be thick, almost more of a dough than a batter. Press the batter into the pan, spreading it out evenly and smoothing the top of it with your hands.

steps.headline: Bake for 25 to 30 minutes.
steps.description: Place the pan into the oven on the center rack. Bake the blondies for 25 to 30 minutes. After 25 minutes, check the doneness of the blondies by inserting a toothpick into the center. If it comes out mostly clean, with only a few moist crumbs clinking to the toothpick, the blondies are ready to be taken out.

steps.headline: Remove the blondies from the oven.
steps.description: Let the blondies cool completely in the pan. Cut them into 16 equally sized squares. Store them in an airtight container, such as Tupperware, for up to five days.

steps.headline: Finished.

text: Making Almond Butter Quinoa Blondies Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C). Set your oven to preheat while you complete the recipe. Line an 8x8 baking pan with parchment paper. Set it aside for now. Mix the coconut oil and almond butter together. Measure out the two ingredients and place them in a medium-sized mixing bowl. Beat them together (either by hand or with an electric mixer set on medium speed) until the ingredients are incorporated and the mixture looks creamy. Add the sugar, vanilla, flax eggs, and almond milk. Measure out these ingredients and place all of them into the bowl with the almond butter-coconut oil mixture. Beat the ingredients together until well-mixed. Whisk together the dry ingredients. Measure out the coconut sugar, quinoa flour, salt and baking powder and place them together in a separate bowl. Use a whisk to mix them together until fully incorporated. Combine the dry ingredients with the wet ones. Dump your bowl of dry ingredients into the bowl holding the coconut oil-almond butter mixture. Mix well until fully incorporated. Fold the chocolate chips into the batter. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes. Pour the batter into the prepared 8x8 baking pan. Check to make sure the oven has fully preheated. Place the pan on the center rack in your oven and allow the blondies to bake for 25 to 30 minutes. You’ll know they’re done when a toothpick inserted into the center comes out with only a few moist crumbs on it. Remove the blondies from the oven. After the blondies have finished baking, pull out the pan and set it aside. Allow the blondies to cool completely in the pan, then cut them into 12 to 16 squares. Store them in an airtight container, such as Tupperware, for up to five days. Baking Gluten-Free Chocolate Chip Quinoa Blondies Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C). Your oven will finish preheating while you complete the rest of the recipe. Line an 8x8 baking pan with parchment paper or foil, letting it overhang slightly on each end. Spray it with cooking spray and set it aside for now. Mix the butter and nut butter together. Measure out the ingredients and place them in a medium-sized mixing bowl. Use an electric mixer to beat the ingredients together until they appear creamy and fully incorporated. Add the eggs, brown sugar and vanilla. Measure out the brown sugar and vanilla and add them to the butter mixture. Crack the eggs, one at a time, and add them to the mixture. Use the mixer to beat the ingredients together until fully incorporated. Combine the dry ingredients. Measure out the quinoa flour, baking powder and salt and place them together in a small bowl. Whisk them together. Combine the dry ingredients with the wet ones. Add the bowl of dry ingredients to the mixing bowl with the butter mixture. Fold them gently together; do not over-mix. Add the chocolate chips. Bake the blondies for 25 to 35 minutes. Spread the batter into the prepared 8x8 baking pan. Make sure to spread it evenly. Place the baking pan into the preheated oven and bake the blondies for 25 to 35 minutes. Check on them around the 25 minute mark. Insert a toothpick into the center. When it comes out with only a few crumbs on it, the blondies are ready to be taken out. Remove the pan from the oven and let cool for 45 minutes. Once cooled, use the overhanging parchment paper (or foil) to help you lift the entire block of blondies out of the pan. Set onto a cutting board or other flat surface and cut them into about 24 equally sized squares. Let the squares finish cooling the rest of the way before storing them in an airtight container. Making Pumpkin Spice Almond Butter Quinoa Blondies Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C). Line an 8x8 baking pan with parchment paper. Set it aside for now. Combine the coconut oil and almond butter. Measure out the ingredients and add them to a mixing bowl. Beat them together until the mixture looks creamy and smooth. Add the sugar, flax eggs, maple syrup, and vanilla. Measure out these ingredients and add them to the butter mixture in the mixing bowl. Beat them with an electric mixer on medium speed until the ingredients are fully incorporated. Combine the dry ingredients. Measure out the coconut sugar, pumpkin pie spice, salt, quinoa flour and baking powder and add them to a separate bowl. Use a whisk to mix the dry ingredients together until well-mixed. Combine the dry and wet ingredients together. Pour the dry ingredients into the bowl holding the wet ingredients. Mix them together completely. Gently fold the chocolate chips into the batter. Transfer the batter into the prepared 8x8 baking pan. It will be thick, almost more of a dough than a batter. Press the batter into the pan, spreading it out evenly and smoothing the top of it with your hands. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes. Place the pan into the oven on the center rack. Bake the blondies for 25 to 30 minutes. After 25 minutes, check the doneness of the blondies by inserting a toothpick into the center. If it comes out mostly clean, with only a few moist crumbs clinking to the toothpick, the blondies are ready to be taken out. Remove the blondies from the oven. Let the blondies cool completely in the pan. Cut them into 16 equally sized squares. Store them in an airtight container, such as Tupperware, for up to five days. Finished.

Baking Gluten-Free Chocolate Chip Quinoa Blondies Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
Your oven will finish preheating while you complete the rest of the recipe.
Line an 8x8 baking pan with parchment paper or foil, letting it overhang slightly on each end.
Spray it with cooking spray and set it aside for now.
Mix the butter and nut butter together.
Measure out the ingredients and place them in a medium-sized mixing bowl.
Use an electric mixer to beat the ingredients together until they appear creamy and fully incorporated.
Add the eggs, brown sugar and vanilla.
Measure out the brown sugar and vanilla and add them to the butter mixture.
Crack the eggs, one at a time, and add them to the mixture.
Use the mixer to beat the ingredients together until fully incorporated.
Combine the dry ingredients.
Measure out the quinoa flour, baking powder and salt and place them together in a small bowl.
Whisk them together.
Combine the dry ingredients with the wet ones.
Add the bowl of dry ingredients to the mixing bowl with the butter mixture.
Fold them gently together; do not over-mix.
Add the chocolate chips.
Bake the blondies for 25 to 35 minutes.
Spread the batter into the prepared 8x8 baking pan.
Make sure to spread it evenly.
Place the baking pan into the preheated oven and bake the blondies for 25 to 35 minutes.
Check on them around the 25 minute mark.
Insert a toothpick into the center.
When it comes out with only a few crumbs on it, the blondies are ready to be taken out.
Remove the pan from the oven and let cool for 45 minutes.
Once cooled, use the overhanging parchment paper (or foil) to help you lift the entire block of blondies out of the pan.
Set onto a cutting board or other flat surface and cut them into about 24 equally sized squares.
Let the squares finish cooling the rest of the way before storing them in an airtight container.
Making Pumpkin Spice Almond Butter Quinoa Blondies Preheat your oven to 350°F (180°C).
Line an 8x8 baking pan with parchment paper.
Set it aside for now.
Combine the coconut oil and almond butter.
Measure out the ingredients and add them to a mixing bowl.
Beat them together until the mixture looks creamy and smooth.
Add the sugar, flax eggs, maple syrup, and vanilla.
Measure out these ingredients and add them to the butter mixture in the mixing bowl.
Beat them with an electric mixer on medium speed until the ingredients are fully incorporated.
Combine the dry ingredients.
Measure out the coconut sugar, pumpkin pie spice, salt, quinoa flour and baking powder and add them to a separate bowl.
Use a whisk to mix the dry ingredients together until well-mixed.
Combine the dry and wet ingredients together.
Pour the dry ingredients into the bowl holding the wet ingredients.
Mix them together completely.
Gently fold the chocolate chips into the batter.
Transfer the batter into the prepared 8x8 baking pan.
It will be thick, almost more of a dough than a batter.
Press the batter into the pan, spreading it out evenly and smoothing the top of it with your hands.
Bake for 25 to 30 minutes.
Place the pan into the oven on the center rack.
Bake the blondies for 25 to 30 minutes.
After 25 minutes, check the doneness of the blondies by inserting a toothpick into the center.
If it comes out mostly clean, with only a few moist crumbs clinking to the toothpick, the blondies are ready to be taken out.
Remove the blondies from the oven.
Let the blondies cool completely in the pan.
Cut them into 16 equally sized squares.
Store them in an airtight container, such as Tupperware, for up to five days.
Finished.
